result.execSummary:
The defendant Forrest Chadwick Biller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Forrest Chadwick Biller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Forrest Chadwick Biller was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Work out payment plan with agent.
Work out payment plan with agent.

No contact with T.W. except as needed in a professional capacity.
No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.

Counseling assessments and follow through as recommended including Anger Management counseling.
Provide DNA sample on 1-6-16 and pay surcharge.
